item.title: The Monkey and the Cap Seller
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling market town, there lived a cap seller named Thomas. Thomas traveled from village to village, selling his colorful caps to the villagers. One sunny day, as Thomas journeyed through a dense forest, he grew tired from the heat and decided to take a nap under a shady tree. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Rooster and the Pearl
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village nestled among green hills, there lived a proud rooster named Rufus. Rufus strutted around the village, boasting about his magnificent plumage and his loud, crowing voice that woke everyone up at dawn. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling meadow, there lived an industrious ant named Andy and a carefree grasshopper named Greg. Summer had arrived, and the meadow was abundant with vibrant flowers and lush greenery. Andy, the ant, was a diligent worker. He spent his days collecting food and storing it in his anthill. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Leopard
item.description: In a dense forest, there lived a clever fox named Felix and a graceful leopard named Leona. Despite being very different in appearance and habits, they were good friends and often shared stories near a serene pond. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Caged Bird and the Free Bird
item.description: In a lush and vibrant forest, there were two birds: one lived in a golden cage, and the other soared freely through the open skies. The caged bird had vibrant plumage, and its melodic songs filled the air. However, no matter how beautiful its cage, the bird longed for the freedom it saw in the free bird that soared above the trees. One day, the free bird landed on the golden bars of the cage, an
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy and the Apple Tree
item.description: In a quaint village nestled between rolling hills, there was a wise old apple tree that stood in the center of a small orchard. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

The other elephants in the jungle had long trunks, but the elephant's child was curious about everything and wanted to know what the crocodile had for dinner. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Little Engine That Could
item.description: In a small town nestled between rolling hills, there was a little blue engine. It wasn't the biggest or the strongest, but it had a heart full of determination. One day, a big train carrying toys and goodies for children broke down on its way over the mountain. The toys and goodies were stranded, and the town was sad because the children were eagerly waiting for their treats. The big engines
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Hedgehog

item.title: The Princess and the Seven Swans
item.description: Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, there was a wise and kind king who had seven sons and a beautiful daughter named Eliza. The queen, unfortunately, had passed away, and the king remarried. However, the new queen was an evil sorceress who despised the king's children, especially Eliza. One day, the wicked queen cast a spell on Eliza's seven brothers, turning them into swans. The curs
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Rabbit
item.description: In a peaceful meadow bordered by a dense forest, there lived a wise and cunning fox named Felix and a timid but clever rabbit named Rosie. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Patty, the milkmaid
item.description: In a small village, there lived a young milkmaid named Patty. Every day, Patty would milk the cows and carry the pail of fresh milk to the market to sell. As she walked, she often daydreamed about the future. One day, while on her way to the market, Patty began to imagine what she would do with the money she earned from selling the milk. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wicked Lion and the Hare
item.description: In a dense and vibrant forest, there lived a wicked lion named Karna. Karna was feared by all the animals because of his cruel and unjust ways. One day, he came across a wise and quick-witted hare named Hari. Karna, driven by his wicked nature, decided to make Hari's life miserable. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Elephants and the King of Mice
item.description: Once upon a time, in a dense and ancient forest, there lived a mighty elephant herd. The elephants, known for their strength and wisdom, were led by a wise and noble elephant named Arjun. Arjun was not only respected by his fellow elephants but also by the other animals in the forest. In the heart of the forest, there existed a community of mice ruled by their wise and just king, named Mahendra.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Crane and the Crab

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Hunter and the Magical Bird

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The crow and the pitcher
item.description: Once upon a scorching summer day, a thirsty crow searched desperately for water. After a long flight, the crow finally spotted a pitcher in a garden. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The weaver and the princess

His intricate designs and vibrant patterns were known throughout the land, and his skill was unmatched. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: A Daring Plan
item.description: Once upon a time in the peaceful town of Eldoria, there lived a young and courageous girl named Maya. Eldoria was known for its lush green fields and vibrant meadows, but it faced a looming threat from a neighboring kingdom. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Real Mother
item.description: Two women came before King Solomon, each claiming to be the mother of the same baby. Both women lived in the same house and had given birth within days of each other. One of the babies had died, and now both women were fiercely arguing over who was the real mother of the living child. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Stolen Crown
item.description: One day, the king's crown went missing, and there was an uproar in the kingdom. The guards were questioned, and an investigation was launched. Suspicion fell on a few courtiers, and they were interrogated, but no one confessed. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Golden Egg
item.description: Once upon a time, in a peaceful village, there lived a poor farmer named John. Despite his modest lifestyle, John was content with his simple life. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Union is Strength
item.description: Once upon a time, there was an old man who had three sons. Despite their constant bickering and disagreements, the old man remained hopeful that his sons would learn the value of unity. To teach them this important lesson, the old man handed each son a single stick and asked them to break it. Unsurprisingly, each son easily snapped his stick in half. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Loyal Mongoose
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a childless couple who longed for a family. One day, their wish was granted when they found a baby mongoose abandoned near their home. Filled with joy, they adopted the little creature and named him Raj. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The foolish thief

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Monkey and the Crocodile
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush jungle beside a glistening river, there lived a clever monkey named Max and a friendly crocodile named Cody. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Be wise while counting

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: A Wise Old Owl
item.description: In the heart of a dense forest, perched high on a sturdy branch, lived a wise old owl named Oliver. With his sparkling eyes and a coat of feathers that glowed in the moonlight, Oliver was respected by all the animals of the forest for his wisdom and counsel. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.description: In a lush vineyard, basking under the warm sun, there hung a cluster of juicy, ripe grapes. Their vibrant colors and tantalizing aroma caught the attention of a clever and cunning fox named Felix. Felix, known for his quick wit and sly nature, desired the sweet taste of those grapes. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Tortoise and the Hare
item.description: In a peaceful forest, there lived a confident and speedy hare and a slow but determined tortoise. The hare was known for his incredible speed and often boasted about his swiftness, making fun of the tortoise for his slow nature. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village nestled among rolling hills, there lived a mischievous young shepherd boy named Peter. Peter's job was to watch over the village's flock of sheep and protect them from any harm. However, Peter had a tendency to get bored easily and seek attention in unusual ways. One sunny day, while tending to his sheep, Peter decided to play a trick on the villagers.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Golden Touch of Midas
item.description: Once upon a time, in a land far away, there lived a wealthy king named Midas. Although he had riches beyond imagination, he was not content with his wealth. He constantly craved for more and desired to possess everything he laid his eyes upon. One day, as he was walking through his magnificent garden, Midas stumbled upon a mysterious creature. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The boasting traveler
item.description: A man came back from a tour and boasted about his adventurous journeys. He talked at length about the different people he met and his amazing feats that got him fame and praise from people everywhere. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The camel and the baby
item.description: One day, a camel and her baby were chatting. The baby asked, “Mother, why do we have humps?” The mother replied, “Our humps are for storing water so that we can survive in the desert”. “Oh”, said the child, “and why do we have rounded feet mother?” “Because they are meant to help us walk comfortably in the desert. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The farmer and the well
item.description: A farmer looking for a source of water for his farm bought a well from his neighbor. The neighbor was cunning, though, and refused to let the farmer take water from the well. On asking why, he replied, “I sold the well to you, not the water”, and walked away. The distraught farmer didn’t know what to do. So he went to Birbal, a clever man and one of the nine courtiers of Emperor
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: True friends love you anyway
item.description: Lord Krishna and Sudama were childhood friends. While Krishna thrived and prospered, Sudama didn’t. He lead the life of a poor Brahmin man, living in a small hut with his wife and kids. Most days, the kids wouldn’t even get enough to eat from what Sudama got as alms. One day, his wife suggested that he go and ask his friend Krishna for help. Sudama was reluctant to seek favors, but he
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Elephant and friends
item.description: A lone elephant wandered the forest looking for friends. She came across a monkey and asked, “Will you be my friend, monkey?” “You are too big and cannot swing on trees as I do. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The wolf and the shepherds
item.description: This is one of the many Aesop’s fables that one can relate to in any day and age. One day a wolf was chased away from a farm for trying to steal some of the sheep for food. Later that week, the wolf came back to the farm hoping to find some food. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The young crab and his mother.
item.description: One day, a young crab and his mother were on the beach, spending some time together. The young crab gets up to move, but it can only walk sideways. His mother scolds him for walking sideways and asks him to walk forward by pointing his toes out front. The young crab responds, “I would like to walk forward mom, but I do not know how to”. Hearing this, his mom gets up to show him how, b
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The other side of the wall
item.description: A young woman inherited a beautiful garden from her grandmother. She loved gardening too and was very proud of her garden. One day, she saw a very beautiful plant in a catalog and wanted that for her garden. She ordered it and planted it at the base of the stonewall in her backyard. She took great care of the plant, which grew quickly and had beautiful green leaves on it. Months passed, but not a
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The dog at the well
item.description: A dog and her pups lived on a farm, where there was a well. The mother dog told the pups, do not go near the well or play around it. One of the pups wondered why they shouldn’t go to the well and decided to explore it. He went to the well. Climbed up the wall and peeked inside. In there, he saw his reflection and thought it was another dog. The pup saw that the other dog in the well (his re
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Controlling anger
item.description: There was once a young boy who had problem controlling his temper. When he became angry, he would just say anything that came to his mind and hurt people. So his father gave him a bag of nails and a hammer and said, “Every time you get angry, hammer one nail into the fence in our backyard”. The first few days the boy hammered so many nails that he emptied half the bag. Over the weeks,
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wet Pants
item.description: A nine-year-old boy was sitting at his desk in class, when suddenly, his pants felt wet, and there was a puddle at his feet. His heart almost skipped a beat, as he got worried that his classmates would see that and make fun of him. He quickly wanted to do something, and saw the teacher and his classmate Susie walking towards him. Susie was carrying a bowl of goldfish. As they came closer, the boy
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Bad Habits
item.description: A wealthy businessman was worried about his son’s bad habits. He sought counsel from a wise, old man. The old man met the man’s son and took him out for a stroll. They walked into the woods, and the old man showed the boy a small sapling and asked him to pull it out. The boy did so with ease, and they walked on. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
